task_summary: Remove the pot lid, relocate the pot onto the plate, then use the spatula tool to push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows a robotic arm operating near a pot with a lid, a round plate on a dark mat, and a spatula-like tool. The robot must first remove the lid from the pot, then grasp and place the pot onto the plate. After placement, the robot must use the tool to push the pot toward the front (operator-facing) edge of the table. The behavior tree sequences perception, manipulation, placement, and tool-mediated pushing with short, binned timeouts.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate, and spatula are on the table and visible.
Workspace is clear enough for safe arm motion.
Robot gripper and tool are compatible with the objects' geometry.
stepwise_plan: Perceive and localize the pot, lid, and plate.
Open the pot by removing the lid.
Compute a side grasp on the pot and grasp it.
Place the pot centered on the plate.
Push the pot toward the front of the table using the tool.
success_criteria: Lid fully removed from the pot.
Pot stably resting on the plate.
Pot pushed toward the front edge, noticeably closer than before.
No collisions that displace other objects off the workspace.
failure_and_recovery: If opening the lid fails, re-perceive and retry.
If grasp is unstable, recompute grasp pose and attempt again.
If placement misaligns, regrasp or re-place onto plate.
If push distance is insufficient, perform an additional push.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful push and final retreat from the workspace.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Remove the lid from the pot.
Plan a side grasp for the pot.
Place the pot onto the plate.
Plan to pick the spatula tool.
Push the pot toward the front using the spatula.

failure_modes: Lid not detached due to friction or misalignment.
Failed grasp on pot or tool.
Pot not centered on plate causing wobble.
Push direction too shallow leading to lateral drift.
recovery_strategy: Recompute grasp pose with alternate strategy (top/side) and retry.
Regrasp and re-place to re-center on plate.
Perform a second push with adjusted direction and distance.
assumptions: Using OpenContainer with container_type='lid' to model lid removal.
Front of the table is along image-down; mapped to direction_deg=180.
Spatula is the available tool for PushWithTool.
Distances/timeouts snapped to nearest allowed bins.

expected_success_criteria: ContainerOpen followed by stable pot placement and forward displacement via PushWithTool.
